author: Tom Becker
comment: Great - except for temps displayed in Kelvin as in another review, and data sometimes blanks. This is on an Asus Zenwatch 2.

author: Dr. Micheal Burns, MAEd, EdD
comment: Has so much information on the screen it's amazing. Sun rise/set, barometer, wind speed/direction humidity, phone/watch battery life info is in addition to the time. Automatic location update is cool but it does not update the time when traveling between time zones (have to select another watch face and then reselect this one). Still it's the only watch face I need.
title: Great

author: Yves Bradette
comment: Would give 5 stars but weather info will disappear after about 10 minutes ever since Marshmallow was installed. Please fix.
title: Info disappears

author: Jose Velez
comment: The weather info and all other details won't show up...same problem with your other faces... Use to work using my Samsung s4... Please help

reply.author: Smartwatch Bureaux
reply.content:
Thank you for your feedback.
Would you please give us your situation in detail?
Please feel free to contact our email address.
Thank you

title: Nexus 6p Android 6.0

author: octave noize
comment: why does the weather along the top, the humidity, wind speed and wind direction randomly disappear now and again? Also, it would be nice to have the current temperature displayed separately, I.e instead of the barometer that I do not require, can you make it so we can swap these? fix these two elements and ill change my rating to 5stars :)
title: my favourite.. but..

author: Bob Walker
comment: Nice watch face, Just big enough text for my old eyes.. I can only get black on green or white on black... where's the green on black? Edit: found it . set to black and white , then select the colour in the next setting.

author: Dov Feder
comment: I can't load this on my gear watch. Developer never responded to my request for help. Disappointing.
title: Looks good but doesn't work

author: Matei Mihai
comment: Nice !!!
title: F03 WatchFace

author: Greg Harrison
comment: Great having all that info onscreen at a glance.  Only problem is with moto 360 the sunrise and sunset time gets cut off. Wish the screen could be zoom out.
title: Love the info

author: Robert Capriulo
comment: I'm as happy as I can be for such tech. It works well and provides tons of info in a small space. Weather does crash on occasion. Worth the the money though, for sure.
title: Well Done!

author: Scott Hupman
comment: very decent! not perfect in its function, but better than all others i used thus far.
title: best screen so far

author: Alexander Schreiber
comment: Really useful set of info in one watchface, like it very much.
title: Great watch face

author: Richard Moore
comment: Does not work

reply.author: Smartwatch Bureaux
reply.content:
Thank you for your feedback.
Would you please tell more in detail about your environment.
Please feel free to contact our email address.
Thank you.

title: Geo

author: Ramon Cofi
comment: Excellent good job    in zen watch

author: purshotam singh
comment: Nice application

author: zac hicks
comment: This is a very good watch face. I really like that all the info I need is right there. But with that said this watch face does eat the watches battery but not drastically but you will notice that the battery life has decreased when the face is on.               Edit: I have also noticed that it also decreases the battery life of the watch itself could you please fix this really annoying when my G watch dies halfway through the day
title: It's good

author: Michael Schaeffer
comment: Somehow this app drains the battery on my phone 15% per hour when I have it set as my watch face on my connected sw3.  Don't know why or how.  I do love the watch face though but battery drain makes it impossible to keep.
title: Phone battery drain

author: Nicholas Sennett
comment: Has plenty of info. I would request adding current temp and conditions (could combine wind direction and speed), Changing active mode color, and round watch face support
title: Good Watch Face

author: Tom Harding
comment: Seems to drain my LG watch in a few hours, whereby my other faces last all day. I set my location to fixed, weather update every three hours and turned the brightness down but still it persists. Lovely looking face and really functional, just not usable due to this.
title: Battery Drain

author: Hex DSL
comment: The toast pop up is too high on the face.  Would prefer it lower.  Great unique looking face with a lot of info.  I really like it
title: Toast too high but great face.

author: Srdan Puskaric
comment: It can't skip the standby screen when powering on if screen is set to sleep. When I tilt my watch it always displays standby b&w or what ever color I chose for a second before switching to active one - green illuminated. Can Yo please fix that and I'll give You 5 star.
title: It's great but..

author: David Stokes
comment: It looks great on my G watch, but for some reason even though it has a ton of information, it first show the current temperature, just the future. Find some way to include the current temp, and this would be a five.
title: Almost There

author: Rob Kinney
comment: This has been my default face for days now - very informational.  Wish there was a spot for current temperature and step count then it would be perfect.
title: Best Watch Face so Far

author: Kenneth Bareuther
comment: I love this watch face, but for me to give it 5 stars, I need a version for Moto 360, it's hard to read all info from the "corners"
title: Round version

author: chris smith
comment: Love this app. Puts all the info I care about on one screen. I didn't care for the green but once I found the black and white option I was sold.
title: All the info I want in one screen!

author: Adam Knauf
comment: Nice!  Tons of info compacted on the watch screen with nice choice of color options
title: Sweet

author: Bryan French
comment: All the info I want on the screen in a very organized manner.
title: Great watch face

author: Per Bonomi
comment: Works perfectly on my Sony Smartwatch 3
title: Very nice

author: Dan LaMettry
comment: Won't load on gear 2 Neo.
title: Doesn't seem to work

author: Tomasz Zurowski
comment: I Love it,Great app

author: George Collins
comment: I don't know what service they use for weather, but the temps, humidity, etc are up to 5 degrees off from NWS, Weather Channel, Weatherbug, or Accuweather.
title: Temps wrong

author: Dawn Grimm
comment: I absolutely love this watch face! But the battery drain is a negative!
title: All in one

author: Richey Ward
comment: Best watch face for LG G

author: Kevin Stabel
comment: The design is good, but this is pretty buggy with notifications. The text gets mangled.  The notification just gets overlaid transparently on the watch face.  The end result is that you can't read either of them.
title: Looks nice, but it's buggy

author: Michael Georgian
comment: If I have this active, even with only hourly updates, my battery dies in about 3-4 hrs (lg g watch)
title: Battery hog

author: Brian Edwards
comment: Very nice.

author: DANIEL MCSHANE
comment: This watchface is very good visually. However, it displays phone battery incorrectly (59% when it is actually 95%) and there is no current temp display. Manual updates do not change anything even when it is known to be out of date.
title: Phone battery innacurate, no temp

author: dexter b
comment: Consumes too much power
title: Like it except for the battery drain
